confession.devil_appearance: black billy-goat (bocq noir) initially; later as 'gros marquaire' (large merchant)
confession.seduction_date: 16 to 18 years earlier during time of great dearth
confession.seduction_context: Approached her twice; first time she sent him away, second time she yielded during period of famine

devil_mark.description: pinched by devil at these locations

powder_types: black powder in form of seeds of percin et cresson
grey powder in form of seeds of percin et cresson
sabbat_activities: sweeping place where sabbat took place
dancing to sound of a flute

witnesses.name: Collatte femme Mengel de la Hault

testimony.quarrel_subject: Failed to do contracted ploughing due to rain
Dispute over garden after Agathe made threatening remark to his wife
testimony.threat_quote: se faisoit bien de la glorieuse de labourer ledit meix, but within a year she would not be working it

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after drinking from spring outside her house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mother refused to wash Agathe's clothes
testimony.threat_quote: she was not ready to die yet, but would languish more than 7 years

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refused her request to sow flax on his land
Horse strayed on her property; she chased it off naked; he called her witch
Refused to plough for her because too busy
Quarrels with Agathe's daughter when guarding animals

testimony.threat_quote: if her goats had not eaten other people's crops they would still be alive

witnesses.name: Claudon le Petit Anthoine de Voinchere

testimony.threat_quote: des verges de dieu (not witchcraft but rods of God)
sy elle pouvoit avoir puissance sur elle, elle la feroit mourir

testimony.quarrel_subject: Physical attack by Agathe who tried to scratch out her eyes
testimony.threat_quote: threatened to cause death of both her and Royne

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dismissed her from service after she hid in hayloft for 3-4 days

timeline.subject: Claude Mengel Grivey alias des Feignes
timeline.details: Extract from confessions of Claude Mengel Grivey naming Agathe as accomplice

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for information to be taken against her

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Confrontation with witnesses; admits to some minor details

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confesses to witchcraft, names accomplices

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Claudon Urbain
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: wife of Lambert du Vic
accomplices_named.context: Named by Claude Mengel Grivey in his confession on January 12, 1611

accomplices_named.name: Collatte femme Colas Valdezey
accomplices_named.context: Named by Claude Mengel Grivey in his confession on January 12, 1611

accomplices_named.name: wife of Jacot Charbonnatte
accomplices_named.context: Named by Agathe as seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Collatte femme Grand Colas
accomplices_named.context: Named by Agathe as seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Jehennon Bon Claude
accomplices_named.context: Named by Agathe as seen at sabbat

prior_accusations.context: Previously imprisoned and released around 18 years earlier (approximately 1593) because indices were insufficient
Told witness 3 just before his death (6-7 years before trial) that she had bewitched him after a dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe's husband (Claudon Urbain)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit sorciere ou il n'en y avoit point au monde, et qu'estant deboutée des gens de ce monde, elle alloit encore au diable
notable_quotes.english: that she was a witch or there were none in the world, and being rebuffed by people of this world, she went to the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe (to Colas Claudon Claude during confrontation)
notable_quotes.context: When accused of witchcraft regarding his ox

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe (about husband)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il a la langue trop grande, et que c'est un glout, et un trouan
notable_quotes.english: that he has too big a tongue, and he is a glutton and a rogue
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation when asked about husband's statement

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe (about escape from previous trial)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en avoit eschappé par ce moyen, et qu'un autre y estant fit ce qu'il pourroit pour evader
notable_quotes.english: that she had escaped by this means [pretending to be foolish], and that another being there should do what they could to escape
notable_quotes.context: Reported by witness 12 about her previous imprisonment 18 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe (to Mengel Urbain)
notable_quotes.context: Her response when confronted about his wife's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe
notable_quotes.french: que messieurs estoient bien aysé d'appaiser, et qu'elle donnoit a uns des napueaux, et aux autres des noixettes, et contrefaisoit la sotte pour estre hors, mais qu'ils n'en auroient plus
notable_quotes.english: that the gentlemen were easy to appease, and she gave turnips to some and hazelnuts to others, and pretended to be foolish to get out, but they wouldn't have any more [of that]
notable_quotes.context: Reported by witness 16 about how Agathe escaped previous trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Royne femme a Bastien Ferry
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle pouvoit avoir puissance sur elle, elle la feroit mourir
notable_quotes.english: that if she could have power over her, she would make her die
notable_quotes.context: Threat made by Agathe after physical fight

relationships.evidence_text: Father had been Mengeon Colas Goiney
Had been in his service more than 20 years before
Both testify about same family (mother, father, sister Magdelaine)
his wife was working there, Fleurant threw himself in water and was drowned
She and husband had sometimes lived in lower room of Agathe's house

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox belonging to Colas Claudon Claude
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell and broke its leg on level ground, leg was set but animal not able to work again
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Failed to do contracted 2 days ploughing due to heavy rain

harms_catalog.victim_name: Fleurant (brother of Nicolas Charmelle's wife)
harms_catalog.harm_description: threw himself in water and was drowned (suicide), goods forfeit to seigneur
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe told his wife 'se faisoit bien de la glorieuse de labourer ledit meix' and predicted within year she would not be working garden

harms_catalog.victim_name: pig belonging to Nicolas Charmelle
Mother of Mengeon Colas le Vieulx Homme
Mother of Mengeon Colas le Vieulx Homme
Magdelaine (sister of witness)
Magdelaine (sister of witness)
Nicolas Le Vieulx Homme (father of witness)
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill after drinking from spring outside her house, died after 6 weeks

harms_catalog.victim_name: goats belonging to witness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness reproached her and called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: foal belonging to witness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness reproached her and called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: calf belonging to witness
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill and died in a week, 'pourit tout vif' (rotted alive)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe came to house after 2 years absence and told wife to fetch back 2 calves from pasture

harms_catalog.victim_name: Mother of Claudon Colas Le Vieulx Homme
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, emaciated and paralysed, languished more than 7 years before dying
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mother refused to wash Agathe's clothes on persuasion of father

harms_catalog.victim_name: pigs belonging to Colas Claudon Grivey
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she asked to sow flax on his land but he refused

harms_catalog.victim_name: various cattle belonging to Claudon Valentin Bertrand
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: horse strayed on her property, she chased it off naked, he called her witch and quarrelled

harms_catalog.victim_name: cows belonging to Claudon Valentin Bertrand
goats belonging to Mengin le Petit Anthoine
harms_catalog.harm_description: two fine goats lost milk, had to sell them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to plough for her because too busy with own work

harms_catalog.victim_name: various animals belonging to Jean Claude Colin
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrels with her daughter, witness and daughter called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: goats belonging to witness or her family
cow belonging to Claudon le Petit Anthoine de Voinchere
harms_catalog.harm_description: slipped at spring and fell 10 feet on its nose, dying in 2 days so 'puante et plaine de poison' that hide not even saleable
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe came by and took good look at his cattle after asking detailed questions

harms_catalog.victim_name: hens near where cow fell
harms_catalog.harm_description: died after passing place where cow fell

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Mengel Urbain
harms_catalog.harm_description: ill and unable to work for 4 years before death

harms_catalog.victim_name: goat belonging to Royne's father
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe warned that 'Villemin' might take one

harms_catalog.victim_name: goats belonging to Royne's father
harms_catalog.harm_description: started dying until witness took herbs from Agathe's garden and gave them to animals
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after first goat taken by wolf

harms_catalog.victim_name: Georgeatte fille le Petit Anthoine
harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 4 years, although relieved after pilgrimage to Ste Reyne
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe attacked her and tried to scratch out her eyes

harms_catalog.victim_name: various animals belonging to Colas George Goenoy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dismissed her from service after she hid in hayloft for 3-4 days

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox belonging to Colas George Goenoy

material_culture.context: Used with blessed candles as protection against hail according to Agathe
Used to protect crops from hail - fix candle to fence
Agathe had one in her house which turned to show direction where lost beasts could be found
Agathe advised giving to sick ox as cure
Given by devil in form of seeds of percin et cresson
Given by devil in form of seeds of percin et cresson
Devil gave her money which turned out to be pieces of lead when she tried to buy bread
Used by foreign healer woman to make bath for paralysed woman
Used by foreign healer woman to make bath for paralysed woman
Royne took herbs from Agathe's garden and gave to dying goats, which stopped losses
Paralysed woman able to do household tasks with aid of stick after treatment
Georgeatte had taken yarn to accused 2 weeks before Christmas
Royne used stone to beat Agathe in physical fight
Agathe gave to officials to appease them during previous trial
Agathe gave to officials to appease them during previous trial
They danced to sound of flute at sabbat

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of most witnesses and accused
Where Agathe spent 5 years, last year in house of mairesse Masson who was executed as witch
Where Agathe was haymaking when hailstorm occurred some 20 years earlier
Where Agathe's aunt lived who taught her anti-hail recipe
Location of Jehennon Bon Claude, accomplice named at sabbat
Where sister of witness 6 consulted a devineresse
Pilgrimage site where Georgeatte went for relief from illness
Location where sabbat took place according to Agathe's confession
Where Nicolas Le Vieulx Homme drank and fell ill
Where Colas Claudon Claude's servant might go if weather cleared; where witness 5 came back from to find Agathe in his house

weather_events: hailstorm some 20 years before trial that spoiled crops
heavy rain that prevented ploughing (witness 3 testimony)
rain that caused witness 5 to come back from woods
animal_predation: wolf carried off goat belonging to Royne's father
economic_hardship_indicators: time of great dearth 16-18 years earlier when Agathe was seduced by devil
Agathe 'ne tenoit grand menage' (didn't keep much of a household) - indicating poverty
money devil gave turned to lead when she tried to buy bread
foreign woman who gave medicines came to village

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Previously imprisoned and released; during previous imprisonment she 'contrefit la sotte' (pretended to be foolish) and abused the chapter and their officers

hearsay_chains.content: Just before his death told witness that Agathe had bewitched him after a dispute
Heard husband say she was a witch or there were none in world, and being rebuffed by people she went to devil

emotional_state_notes: during previous imprisonment 'contrefit la sotte' (pretended to be foolish)
agreed she deserved death and hoped God would give her grace to endure it patiently

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: he was 'rude homme' and had probably worked ox too hard, as his father often did

third_parties.name: mairesse Masson
third_parties.context: Agathe spent last year of 5 years at St Dié in her house; she was subsequently executed as a witch

third_parties.name: Nicolas Le Vieulx Homme
third_parties.context: Died 6-7 years before trial, told witness 3 she had bewitched him after dispute; also father of witnesses 5 and 6

third_parties.name: Magdelaine
third_parties.context: Languished 5 years before death, blamed Agathe, chased her from house because feared her

third_parties.name: Fleurant
third_parties.context: Threw himself in water and drowned within year of Agathe's threat

third_parties.name: Didier George
third_parties.context: Told Royne to wash hands every morning, making sign of cross; denied having billy-goat

third_parties.name: foreign woman who gave medicines
third_parties.context: Came to village and said mother of witnesses 5 and 6 was bewitched; treated her with bath of racines de jancine and wild cress

third_parties.name: devineresse in Burgundy
third_parties.context: Sister of witnesses 5 and 6 consulted her; said she was bewitched and could only suggest pilgrimage

third_parties.name: Jehennon femme Colas Claudon Grivey
third_parties.context: Agathe said she learned anti-hail recipe from her (but also claimed it was from aunt at Gerhadel)

third_parties.name: Claude Mengel Grivey alias des Feignes
third_parties.context: Convicted of witchcraft, named Agathe as accomplice in confession on January 12, 1611; committed suicide by drowning

third_parties.name: wife of Lambert du Vic
third_parties.context: Sister of Claude Mengel Grivey, named as accomplice in his confession

third_parties.name: Vincent
third_parties.context: Witness 12 told him about cow death and called Agathe witch

third_parties.name: Georgeatte (girl beaten by Agathe)
third_parties.context: Agathe beat her until Royne took her away

third_parties.name: Villemin
third_parties.context: Name Agathe used when warning about wolf/goat - possibly code for wolf or devil

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over labor contracts (ploughing, washing clothes); Agathe described as 'ne tenoit grand menage' (didn't keep much household), indicating poverty; worked as servant for Colas George Goenoy more than 20 years before; garden rental dispute led to brother's suicide and property forfeiture; husband described as artisan and woodcutter for charcoal-burners (modest occupation)

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is detailed and well-preserved. Agathe had been previously imprisoned and released approximately 18 years before (c.1593) when evidence was insufficient. She was named as accomplice by her brother Claude Mengel Grivey who was convicted of witchcraft. Multiple witnesses testify to long reputation (10-20 years). Confession obtained under torture. Pattern of maleficia follows typical quarrel-threat-harm sequence. Economic status indicators suggest poverty. Brother's suicide by drowning mentioned during torture.
